name: MistralAIModel

input.content:
I have a webpage that's open in a chrome browser but the page no longer exists. 
What javascript should I type in the console to get a copy of the entire page html?

output:
You can use the following JavaScript code in the Chrome Developer Console to get a copy of the entire page HTML:

```javascript
let html = document.documentElement.outerHTML;
console.log(html);
```

This will print the entire HTML of the page to the console. You can then right-click on the logged output and select "Save as" to save it as a HTML file.

However, please be aware that if the page no longer exists on the server, this method will only capture the current state of the page in your browser, which may not be the complete or most up-to-date version of the page. If the page has been removed from the server, you may want to look into using a web archiving service like the Wayback Machine to access a cached version of the page.

name: WordEvaluator
